2. Synthesis and Characterisation  General procedure (GP1) for the synthesis of O-substituted 4- tert-butyl-2,6 -diformylphenols: 4-tert-butyl-2,6-diformylphenol (1 equiv) and potassium carbonate (6 eqiv) were suspended in dimethylformamide and alkyl iodide (1 equ iv) was added. After addition, the yellow solution was stirred for 16 h at 70 ¡ãC. The solution was cooled to room temperature, water (30-40 mL) and dichloromethane (30-40 mL) were added and the layers separated. The organic layer was washed with water (2 ¡Á 30-40 mL), 1N ammonium chloride solution (2 ¡Á 70-80 mL) and brine (40 mL) and dried over sodium sulphate.

Synthesis of 2-(benzyloxy)-5 -(tert-butyl)isophthalaldehyde (4d): According to GP1, 4 -tert-butyl-2,6-diformyl-phenol (310 mg, 1.50 mmol) and potassium carbonate (1.22 g, 8.83 mmol) were suspended in dimethylformamide (17 mL) and benzyl iodide (0.19 mL, 1.51 mmol) was added and the reaction mixture stirred at 70 ¡ãC. After workup, the oily yellow residue was purified by flash chromatography (petroleum ether/dichloromethane 1:1, Rf =0.24) to give after drying in vaccum 342 mg (76%) of 4d as a white solid.

General procedure (GP2) for the reaction of triamine 1 and salicyldialdehyde ethers 4a-4d by ¡®Method A ¡¯: Triptycene triamine 1 (4 equiv) and dialdehyde 4a-4d (6 equiv) were dissolved under argon in dry THF and TFA (2 mol% in THF) was added. The solution was refluxed, in an apparatus connected with a dropping funnel with molecular sieves 4?. After two days, half of the solvent was distilled off and the solution was cooled to room temperature and n-pentane (30-50 mL) was added. The precipitate was collected by suction filtration and washed with n-pentane (5 mL). After drying under vacuum, a defined amount of the crude product (3.104-3.669 mg) was dissolved together with a defined amount of mesitylene (0.452-0.639 mg), which was used as internal standard in 1H NMR spectroscopy, to calculate the yield of the formed products, by integration of characteristic signals of the pure compounds, known from method B (see below).

Attempted synthesis of cage compound 5a by method A : According to GP2, triptycene triamine 1 (47 mg, 0.16 mmol) and 5-tert-butyl-2-methoxyisophthalaldehyde ( 4a) (52 mg, 0.23 mmol) were dissolved in dry THF (42  mL) and TFA (3.5 ¦ÌL). After two days, a yellow solid (62 mg) was obtained, which contains cage compound 5a (17%, calculated by 1H NMR spectroscopy).

Attempted synthesis of cage compound 5b by method A : According to GP2, triptycene triamine 1 (35 mg, 0.12 mmol) and 5 -(tert-butyl)-2-propoxyisophthalaldehyde ( 4b) (42 mg, 0.17 mmol) were dissolved in dry THF (40 mL) and TFA (2.5 ¦ÌL). After two days, a yellow solid (56 mg) was obtained, which contains cage compound 5b (24%, calculated by 1H NMR spectroscopy).

Attempted synthesis of cage compound 5c by method A: According to GP2, triptycene triamine 1 (54 mg, 0.18 mmol) and 2-(allyloxy)-5 -(tert-butyl)isophthalaldehyde  (4c) (67 mg, 0.27 mmol) were dissolved in dry THF (40 mL) and TFA (3.0 ¦ÌL). After two days, a y ellow solid (79 mg) was obtained, which contains cage compound 5c (23%, calculated by 1H NMR spectroscopy).

Attempted synthesis of cage compound 5d by method A: According to GP2, triptycene triamine 1 (52 mg, 0.17 mmol) and 2-(benzyloxy)-5 -(tert-butyl)isophthalaldehyde (4d) (78 mg, 0.26 mmol) were dissolved in dry THF (40 mL) and TFA (3.2 ¦ÌL). After two days, a yellow solid (93 mg) was obtained, which contains cage compound 5d (38%, calculated by 1H NMR spectroscopy).

General Procedure (GP3) for Postfunctionalization by¡¯ Method B¡¯ : Cage compound 3 (1 equiv) and potassium carbonate (34 - 46 equiv) were suspended under argon in dry DMF or dry DMSO (4 mL) in a screw capped vessel and alkyl iodide/bromide were added (7.2 - 9.3 equiv). After stirring at 70 ¡ãC for 16 h the red-purple suspension was cooled to room temperature,  the precipitate was collected by suction filtration and washed with dry DMF or dry DMSO (2¡Á4 mL), methanol (2¡Á4 mL) and n-pentane (2¡Á4 mL). The yellow residue was dissolved in dry THF or dry DCM (5 mL) and filtered through a 25 mm syringe filter (0.45 ¦Ìm PTFE). The solvent was removed by rotary evaporation to give after drying under vacuum the desired post-functionalized cage compound.

After 16 h, the precipitate was  dissolved in dry THF and cage compound 5a was obtained as a yellow solid (47 mg, 81%). Cage compounds 5a¨C5dwere investigated by nitrogensorption at 77 K to examine the impact of the introducedmoieties on the specific surface areas determined by theBrunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) model. All samples weredegassed at 2008C and 6 /C148 10/C02mbar for 3 h, prior to themeasurement. As expected, with increasing bulkiness of theintroduced moieties, the specific surface area decreases. Forinstance, the propylated cage 5bgave a lower BET surfacearea (491 m2g/C01) than the methylated cage 5a(824 m2g/C01).

The allylated cage 5cshowed a slightly lower specific surface(333 m2g/C01) than 5b. If the bulky benzyl substituent isintroduced, almost all of the voids interior is ¡°filled¡±, whichresults in a BET surface area of 119 m2g/C01. Investigating thematerials after performing the gas sorption experiments bypowder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) revealed that all thesamples are mainly amorphous (Supporting Information). Itwas reported before that the permanent porosity of peripherysubstituted [4+6] cage compounds is strongly depending onthe morphology,[7d,16]which encouraged us to obtain crystal-line material of the post-synthetic modified cage compounds.

[20]We appliedthis method to crystalline 5ato desolvate the material atroom temperature (to give 5acr(rt)) and indeed, with1700 m2g/C01, the specific BET surface area is nearly doublethat of the amorphous material. It is worth mentioning, thatthis value is higher than for as-synthesized cage compound 3(1377 m2g/C01) but lower than for crystalline 3(2071 m2g/C01) andconsequently the second highest reported for intrinsicallyporous materials derived from organic molecules.

[21]Consequently,surface area and pore-size have a major effect for theadsorption of non-polar gases, such as methane. As expected,the curve progression for the heat of adsorptions of methaneis very similar for both 3and 5acr(rt) with DHads(3)=40.7 kJmol/C01andDHads(5a)=36.1 kJmol/C01(Table 2). Thissuggests that only dispersion interactions are responsible andthe material with the higher specific surface area ( 3,2071 m2g/C01)[7d]shows a slightly better performance.

Markus W. Schneider, Iris M. Oppel, Alexandra Griffin, and Michael Mastalerz*
Markus W. Schneider, Iris M. Oppel, Alexandra Griffin, and Michael Mastalerz*

In 2008, we introduced the one-pot synthesis of the endo-functionalized [4+6] cage compound 3by reacting fourmolecules of triamine 1and six molecules of salicyldialdehyde2(Scheme1).[14]What distinguishes this type of cage com-pounds from others, is that it bears six hydroxy groupspointing to the center of the cage cavity. This structural motif is very rare for organic cage compounds, and the functional-ization of the cages interiors through reaction at the hydroxygroups was to date unsuccessful. Herein we present a facilemethod for the post-synthetic modification of the intrinsicvoids in the cage compound, which allows the pore structureof the resulting material to be ¡°fine-tuned¡± in the solid state.
